message.content:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: 
```java
import java.util.*;
import java.io.*;

public class PrimeByVector{
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        final int NUMBER_PER_LINE = 10;
        int count = 0;
        Vector vector = new Vector();
        System.out.println("The primes before 92 are: \n");
        for (int n = 2; n < 92; n++) {
            boolean isPrime = true;
            for (int i = 0; i < vector.size(); i++) {
                int primeNumber = ((Integer)(vector.elementAt(i))).intValue();
                if (primeNumber > Math.sqrt(n)) break;
                if (n % primeNumber == 0) {
                    isPrime = false;
                    break;
                }
            }
            if (isPrime) {
                count ++;
                vector.addElement(new Integer(n));
                if (count % NUMBER_PER_LINE == 0) {
                    System.out.println(n);
                } else {
                    System.out.print(n + " ");
                }
            }
        }
        PrintWriter writer = null;
        try {
            writer = new PrintWriter("VectorDump", "UTF-8");
            Iterator it = vector.iterator();
            while(it.hasNext()) {
                writer.write(it.next() + " ");
            }
            writer.close();
        } catch (Exception e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: The PrintWriter.write() method is used to write the contents of the Vector to the file "VectorDump". The PrintWriter is initialized within a try-catch block to handle any IOException that may occur. The contents of the Vector are written to the file using an Iterator to traverse the Vector. After all the contents have been written, the PrintWriter is closed.
